title: Consolidate OverlayTimerTask-specific methods
message:
Consolidate OverlayTimerTask-specific methods

getUniqueDogeism, checkWowTextConflict, layoutParamsToRect, and
overlayUiRunnable have been moved into OverlayTimerTask since it's the
only place where these are used.

title: Do even more animation work in the background
message:
Do even more animation work in the background

setDoge has been moved into an AsyncTask reducing the amount of setup
work it needs to do on the UI thread. The GetWeather task has been
refactored to get more done in its doInBackground. A WeatherDataTask
has been created to offload some of the animation work that was done
in the GetWeather onPostExecute (UI thread!).

title: Remove redundant background tasks
message:
Remove redundant background tasks

This increases performance and animation speed by posting directly to
the UI thread instead of posting to a background thread and /then/
posting to the UI thread.

Additionally, we are not making a "new" call within the
AnimationListener

title: Start up with a less offensive color
message:
Start up with a less offensive color

Instead of starting completely white and then drawing our MainActivity
this starts us off with a more subtle gray.

message:
Moved OverlayTimerTask to the bottom

message:
Background bitmap creation optimization

thread.

message: Remove dead Gingerbread-only code

title: Created Google Play and FOSS flavors
message:
Created Google Play and FOSS flavors

Weather Doge can now be built in two distinct flavors. One that uses
Google Play Services’s FusedLocationApi and the other uses the AOSP
LocationManager. This is facilitated by a new LocationApi class that
has a common API between build flavors. It transparently handles the
details of both location services. The FOSS flavor will have no Google
Play Services code.

Closes #5

title: Fixed an NPE occurring with poor location settings
message:
Fixed an NPE occurring with poor location settings

The app could crash when location services are off. Or, more
confusingly, when location services are set to “Device only” which just
uses the GPS. Gathering an approximate location with GPS seem entirely
possible but GMS is not willing to feed us the data. Perhaps it cannot
do the approximate location fuzzing with just GPS for some reason.

Instead of crashing the app will now give the user possible solutions
via toast.

message:
Fixed a time text rendering bug

Pushing it down by one pixels seems to help. I do not know why this

title: Reset the CountDownLatch on every run
message:
Reset the CountDownLatch on every run

Sometimes the same WidgetService instance would be used to execute two
or more updates causing Play Services connection errors. It appears
that only one onHandleIntent will run at a time so there's no need to
do any synchronization. I could be wrong on this though. :|

Change the default widget sky and doge

title: Replace the widget "just now" text with the time
message:
Replace the widget "just now" text with the time

The time is displayed in the proper locale according to Android. Worth
noting that the time displayed is not the time the widget was refreshed
but the time that the data was retrieved from the API. This could be as
much as 10 minutes into the past after a widget refresh as the internal
cache will be invalid every 10 minutes.

title: Added options for the widget
message:
Added options for the widget

A number of new widget-specific options are now available. These
include setting the font to Comic Neue (separately from the main app),
selecting a refresh interval (default 30 minutes), force a widget
reload on tap (default is now to open app on tap), and a background fix
toggle (default off) to help the widget display properly on certain
device configurations.

If any changes are detected when the user exits the OptionsActivity
all widgets are reloaded. OptionsActivity has also had its settings
organized into three distinct categories. The general options that both
the app and widget use. The app-specific options. And the
widget-specific options.

title: Slightly change up the images displayed for rain
message: Slightly change up the images displayed for rain

title: WidgetService toasts are now displayed
message:
WidgetService toasts are now displayed

Since IntentServices operate on a background thread they do not have
the ability to show toasts. By posting to the initial main thread we
can interact with the UI.

title: Check arguments sent to getTextBitmaps
message:
Check arguments sent to getTextBitmaps

If one of the String arguments is empty it will cause a problem
(read: Exception) when trying to paint the text. Instead of halting the
entire process let's just spoof what we don't have.

title: Vastly improved widget error handling
message:
Vastly improved widget error handling

When the proverbial shit hits the fan, WeatherService now does a far
better job of logging what happened and giving the user a hint of what
went wrong. This small toast allows us to begin debugging before we are
given log output and alerts the user that the update process actually
finished.

title: Align widget temp text to left instead of center
message:
Align widget temp text to left instead of center

It would look pretty good when centered if the text below it was short
but as the text below it gets longer the temperature text would be
pushed away from the left of the screen and begin to touch doge.
Aligning to the left gives a consistent look and feel.

title: Consistent widget text drop shadows across devices
message:
Consistent widget text drop shadows across devices

Shadows now look relatively similar on varying display densities. Some
devices didn't seem to render the shadow correctly when the X and Y
offsets were fractional. Slight padding issues have also been resolved
by increasing it overall and converting to dips.

title: Add Leyton!
message: Add Leyton!

title: Add loading text on widget refresh
message:
Add loading text on widget refresh

The location text of the widget is now changed to "Loading..." before
the refresh process. This lets the user know something is actually
happening. Perhaps something more eye-catching will be done in the
future but this is certainly good enough for now. I imagine this text
will be extra comforting for those on slower devices which may take
significantly longer to complete the refresh.

title: strings.xml refactor
message: strings.xml refactor

title: (Hopefully) fix empty location bug
message:
(Hopefully) fix empty location bug

Sometimes a location would not be available. The app would not crash
but no location would be displayed. It seemed like it could be rooted
in the geocoder logic. I previously assumed that if the Address object
is not null then it must have a locality property. This is not always
the case.

Now a WeatherData object should always have its place property set. It
will be either the search location passed in or the location retrieved
from the weather API. We can use this as a fallback in the event our
geocoder service fails.

I say hopefully because it was very difficult to pinpoint this bug and
I haven't tested enough to confirm it will not pop up again.

title: Refresh individual widgets on resize >= Jelly Bean
message:
Refresh individual widgets on resize >= Jelly Bean

App widgets are now automatically refreshed when they are resized.
Unfortunately it’s not very fast but it’s much faster than refreshing
every single instance if you have more than one. This only applies to
devices that support widget resizing which is Jelly Bean (4.1, API 16)
and up.

title: Update build tools, Play Services, and support-v4
message:
Update build tools, Play Services, and support-v4

The deprecated location APIs have now been removed from Play Services
so MainActivity and WidgetService were updated to use the new
GoogleApiClient and FusedLocationApi.

title: Refactored WidgetService to work on Android 4.1
message:
Refactored WidgetService to work on Android 4.1

Apparently cloning a RemoteViews object that holds Bitmaps is a bad
idea on Android 4.1. It appears to work just fine on nearly everything
else. To make things go more smoothly the solution was to still
generate the common bitmaps once but create a fresh RemoteViews object
each time.

Even with this fix sometimes the image generated is too small. I doubt
there’s a fix on my end since the problem appears to be with the
launcher. Perhaps provide an option for users to force the Gingerbread
compatibility image if it’s not working for them?

Sometimes getSkyBitmap will throw an exception because it is fed bogus
options data from the launcher. Not much I can do about that so I just
wrapped it in a try/catch and force it to fall back to the Gingerbread
compatibility image.

Added additional checks before recycling Bitmap objects to avoid
throwing an exception.

message:

title: Rounded top corners on the widget, refactoring
message:
Rounded top corners on the widget, refactoring

The top corners of the widget are now rounded just like the bottom two.
In order to do this we have to scale the sky image on our own since
Android's RemoteViews and app widgets are so limited. Location text is
now properly aligned as well in the blue bottom bar. Some further
tweaks are still required to get everything working properly especially
with the drop shadows.

The refactored approach taken to updating multiple app widgets should
be resistant to bitmap memory leaks.

title: Kickass error handling for weather data
message:
Kickass error handling for weather data

Before, error handling was relatively… poor and was pretty much
returning null if anything bad happened. Thanks to a new WeatherResult
class that wraps around WeatherData it's easy for the calling code to
see how things went. If things did not go so smoothly a good bit of
error information is available that can be reported to the user or
logged.

title: Update MainActivity with WeatherUtil, Cache APIs
message:
Update MainActivity with WeatherUtil, Cache APIs

All the great refactoring from WeatherUtil and the Cache class is now
used by the application. There's still some work to be done to make
certain it can fail without imploding. The default weather source is
set to Yahoo but this will eventually be an option. Yahoo will most
likely replace OpenWeatherMap as the default.

This commit largely completes the initial refactoring started @ e2bf9ba

title: Add a memory cache for super fast access to data
message: Add a memory cache for super fast access to data

title: Added a static Cache class
message:
Added a static Cache class

This replaces the current solution which is tightly coupled with
MainActivity. The cache expiry logic is nearly identical but the
preferences database is no longer used to store JSON data. To save the
weather data we just serialize the given WeatherData object. This might
be a little faster but it's definitely easier and we no longer need to
keep track of the fields. Since it's stored in the app's cache dir
users can clear the cache without having to reset their options.

Storing weather data is async since it's no big deal if it fails but it
is a big deal if it takes too long. Fetching cached data is not async
because you care about the result and the result is likely tied to some
UI event. The caller probably already has an AsyncTask so why make
another if we don't need to?

This class is highly specific now but can be updated later to include
any type of data.

title: Improved non-private WeatherUtil endpoints
message: Improved non-private WeatherUtil endpoints

title: Chain Editor calls and prefer apply()
message: Chain Editor calls and prefer apply()

title: Update build config yet again
message:
Update build config yet again

Apache Commons IO is now included via Maven instead of directly via JAR

title: Introduced the powerful WeatherUtil class
message:
Introduced the powerful WeatherUtil class

WeatherUtil is a helper class for getting up-to-date weather data from
a variety of sources. Currently these sources are OpenWeatherMap and
Yahoo. Yahoo's API tends to be more accurate but we must convert
Yahoo's weather status codes to OpenWeatherMap icon codes to display
the correct doge adjectives and images. This class is far from complete
and not yet used anywhere.

WeatherUtil will not handle the caching of weather data but it does
provide a simple WeatherData class that can be serialized for storage.

An OpenWeatherMap APP ID string is now available to be set in the build
configuration. This is optional but will be set in Google Play releases
of Weather Doge. Yahoo's weather API is public and does not provide a
means to set an API key.

Eventually WeatherUtil will be the app's primary (and only) endpoint
for retrieving new unified weather data.

title: Doge-isms can now be shown above weather info
message:
Doge-isms can now be shown above weather info

Unlike some other options this one does not automatically apply
itself to the existing views. Doing so is possible but would require
a lot of care to make sure there isn't a race condition with the
WOW_INTERVAL timer. By simply creating and destroying views within
the timer itself we avoid this problem entirely the only drawback
being only new views will reflect the current configuration. Just
trying to keep it simple.

title: Introduced drop shadow configuration
message:
Introduced drop shadow configuration

Shibes can now experiment with different drop shadow values. There's
a nice little custom dialog that allows for live testing too!

I decided not to label the seek bars as once you move them around it
becomes painfully obvious what each one does.

Not all possible drop shadow values will display properly on all
devices all the time. The defaults should work everywhere but
padding needs to be adjusted for different values. Padding increases
the distance between TextViews so it isn't an ideal solution for
space-sensitive areas like the bottom of the MainActivity. I used
padding conservatively there and it shows once you go crazy with the
x and y offsets. Oh well.

title: Add option to replace Comic Sans with Comic Neue
message:
Add option to replace Comic Sans with Comic Neue

Comic Neue is an attractive reimagining of the classic casual
typeface Comic Sans. See comicneue.com

Roboto Thin has been included for its degree symbol. Neue's degree
doesn't seem to fit very well with the rest of the font.

title: KitKat status bar and refactored duplicate styles
message:
KitKat status bar and refactored duplicate styles

Had to do some weird height compensation with the sky bitmap resizing
or else the bitmap would not resize to the full width of the screen.
Not exactly certain as to why and it may not work properly for all
KitKat devices. 4px is just another magic number at this point. It
could honestly have been a bug all along (on all versions of Android)
but was hidden somehow.

title: GPL and copyright notice now in compiled app.
message:
GPL and copyright notice now in compiled app.

An explicit copyright notice has been added to the About dialog. A copy
of the GNU GPLv3 is now included in the final APK.

title: Weather data updates are now animated (issue #3)
message:
Weather data updates are now animated (issue #3)

GetWeather’s onPostExecute has been completely refactored. The old
background now fades in to the new one. The logic for that has been
moved to setBackground. Our dear doge has also been animated with the
setDoge method. The status, temperature, and location text fields are
animated now too. On Gingerbread (older devices) they fade out and in
as one. On other devices they fade out and in sequentially and
(delayed) simultaneously. onPostExecute directly handles those
shenanigans.

currentTemp now always holds the API’s representation of temperature
(Kelvin) to make comparisons easier. currentlyMetric is true when we’re
displaying a metric representation of currentTemp, and false otherwise.

Need to be on the lookout for conditions where currentlyAnim is not
reset back to false. The variable is meant to prevent concurrent
updates from starting conflicting animations.

title: wow cache. issue #1.
message:
wow cache. issue #1.

The GetWeather task has been largely refactored. Default cache length
is at 10 minutes. Cache is also based on location. GPS coordinates are
fuzzed to avoid cache invalidations by slight variations in location.

Fuzz info: http://gis.stackexchange.com/a/8674
